UlrichConversation: ^ULRICH: I heard about that business with the girl,

b: ^ I'm glad to hear she's alright
^ I'm sorry to hear about her passing.

UlrichConversation: ^ Do you know what ailed her?

s: ^ a terrible fever and some bruising. Nothing to worry yourself about.
^LEECH: I'm not entirely sure, but I hope to find out.

c-0: ^ULRICH: Ah, but illness harms most especially the youngest and eldest. I've been around long enough to know that what concerns the little ones concerns me too.
^He sighs and glares at the sky.
^ULRICH: Well, just let me know if I need to be worried about something going 'round. We're neighbors, after all.

s: ^LEECH: I will, Ulrich, you needn't truly worry.
^LEECH: Yes, yes. If this turns out to be some apocalyptic plague I'll be sure to let you know.
^LEECH: To be honest, I'm not quite sure what her illness
^. But trust me, panicking won't do any good right now.

c-0: ^ULRICH: Alright, then I'll save my worrying for other problems. Thank you, Leech. Good day, then.
c-1: ^His brow furrows as he searches your expression, unsatisfied with your answer.
^ULRICH: Sure. You'd best be going now. Wouldn't want to get in the way of someone so important as yourself.
c-2: ^ULRICH: Well. I appreciate your honesty. Even with all those books and your fancy education, it seems you don't know everything. I s'pose we'll just have to pray the girl

b: ^is the only one to die of it

c-2: ^ULRICH: Anyways, I won't bother you any longer. Good day, Leech.
